B1 an informal name for someone or something, especially a name that you are called by your friends or family, usually based on your real name or your character: We always use the nickname Bee for our daughter Elizabeth. "Darwin" was the nickname he was given at high school, because of his interest in science. Synonyms
handle (NAME) informal
moniker humorous
name
sobriquet formal

to give someone or something a nickname: The campsite has been nicknamed "tent city" by visiting reporters. Because he always dressed in black, colleagues nicknamed him Dr Death.
